question: 名刺
sourceMnemonic: Take your <kanji>name</kanji> and <kanji>stab</kanji> someone with it... using your <vocabulary>business card</vocabulary>. Your business card has your name on it. Also, you "stab" it at people who are willing to take it and read it. Not a real stab, but a metaphorical.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.

relatedVocab.ergativeTwin: あの会社の社長さんから名刺をもらいました。
